required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fingolimod Effect on Cytokine and Chemokine Levels
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Fingolimod (GilenyaÂ®) on Cytokine and Chemokine Levels in Relapsing Remitting Multiple Sclerosis Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
The main purpose of this study was to measure the serum levels of cytokines and chemokines that are known to increase during multiple sclerosis relapses.
Cytokines are a broad and loose category of small proteins that are important in cell signaling.
The second purpose of the study was to test the cytokine/chemokine changes measured in the 3rd and 6th months on the efficacy parameters.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A 6-month, multicenter, prospective, interventional, single arm, open label study investigating the effects of fingolimod administered according to local label recommendations on Cytokine and Chemokine Levels in Relapsing Remitting Multiple Sclerosis Patients

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline Serum Cytokine and Chemokine Levels of Healthy Controls and RRMS Patients - ELISA
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples were taken at baseline and measurements were performed before treatment of fingolimod.

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline Flow Cytometry Analyses for Blood Cytokines and Chemokines in Healthy Controls and RRMS Patients
primary_outcome.description: baseline peripheral blood flow cytometric analysis in study participants

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Blood Cytokines and Chemokines Via Flow Cytometry Analyses of Healthy Controls and RRMS Patients at Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Baseline peripheral blood flow cytometric analyses in study participants evaluated by flow cytometry analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Cytokine and Chemokine Levels inRRMS Patients Between Visits
secondary_outcome.description: Change of serum cytokine and chemokine levels measured by ELISA in RRMS patients treated with fingolimod between visits

secondary_outcome.measure: Peripheral Blood Cytokine and Chemokine Measurements in Healthy Controls and RRMS Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood chemokine cytokine levels measured by flow cytometry during fingolimod treatment in healthy controls at baseline and in RRMS patients between visits

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Peripheral Blood Cytokine and Chemokine Measurements in Healthy Controls and RRMS Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood chemokine cytokine levels measured by flow cytometry at baseline and between visits during fingolimod treatment. Absolute counts of the cells were calculated according to the absolute lymphocyte counts and the percentages of cells. This allowed for a clear determination of cell counts and thus increased the reliability of the results.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Peripheral Blood Cytokine and Chemokine Measurements in Healthy Controls and RRMS Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood chemokine cytokine levels measured by flow cytometry in healthy controls at baseline and in RRMS patients between visits during fingolimod treatment

arm_group.description: Healthy volunteers with no intervention or drug administered.

intervention.description: 66 relapsing remitting MS (RRMS) patients were recruited. Patients who met all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria were treated by Fingolimod 0.5 mg.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
1. Written informed consent must be obtained before the beginning of te study
2. Nonresponder RRMS patients
3. Last relapse of the patient should be at least 2 months before study entry.
4. Last interferon or glatiramer acetate dose of the patient should be at least 1 month before study entry.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with secondary progressive MS.
2. Patients with known contraindications for fingolimod treatment.
3. Other coexistent autoimmune diseases
4. Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 60 healthy controls and 66 Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) patients were enrolled in the study. The healthy volunteers had only Visit 1 (Day 0). Fingolimod 0.5 mg capsule once daily was given on the same day to RRMS patients. Patients were treated for 6 months with 2 additional visits, Visit 2 and Visit 3.

This allowed for a clear determination of cell counts and thus increased the reliability of the results.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) are collected from First Patient First Visit (FPFV) until Last Patient Last Visit (LPLV). All AEs reported in this record are from date of First Patient First Visit until 30 days after Last Patient Last Visit) up to approximately 2 years.
reported_events.desc: Only patients who received at least one dose of the investigational drug (N=66) were included in the data set used for safety.

group.title: Fingolimod 0.5 mg
group.description: Relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS) patients were treated with fingolimod 0.5 mg capsule od.

group.title: All Patients
group.description: All patients in the trial

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
